350.title: Uddhav writes to 15 Sena MLAs, thanks them for supporting: Report
350.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray reportedly wrote to 15 Shiv Sena MLAs, thanking them for their support during tough times, without surrendering to the pressure of threats or offers. He also called for a meeting with all Shiv Sena MPs at his residence 'Matoshree,' to take a decision on the next week's Presidential election, the report said.

351.title: Heavy rains uproot trees in 10 places across Pune, two cars damaged
351.article_body: As heavy rains lashed Pune, trees were uprooted in 10 places across the city on Sunday. Two cars were also damaged after trees fell on them amid the rains. Reports said that no casualties were reported in these incidents and the Pune fire brigade cleared the trees from roads. 13 trees were uprooted in the city on Friday.

352.title: Japan's ruling party wins Upper House polls after Abe's assassination
352.article_body: Japan's ruling party, Liberal Democratic Party (LDP), along with its coalition partner won a major victory in the Upper House elections on Sunday, days after the assassination of former PM Shinzo Abe. The LDP and its coalition partner now have a seat share of 146 out of the total 248. The country's PM Fumio Kishida welcomed the victory.

353.title: Sourav, Sehwag, Yuvraj all have been dropped when not in form: Venkatesh
353.article_body: Ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad has said all out-of-form players should be dropped irrespective of their reputation. "Sourav, Sehwag, Yuvraj, Zaheer, Bhajji (Harbhajan) all have been dropped when not in form...The yardsticks seem to have changed...there is rest for being out of form," he tweeted. Notably, Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested for West Indies ODIs.

354.title: Working on 'Shamshera' was a nightmare: Ranbir Kapoor
354.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said in an interview that working on 'Shamshera' was a nightmare. He added that it was the most physically draining film for him and his co-star Vaani Kapoor. "We were covered in dust. We were shooting in peak summer in Mumbai wearing woollen clothes. I also had a thick beard. So, it was really hard," said Ranbir.

355.title: Centre bound to honour commitment to Portugal, free Abu Salem after 25-year term: SC
355.article_body: The Supreme Court has said the Centre is bound to honour its commitment given to Portugal and release gangster Abu Salem on completion of his 25-year sentence in the 1993 Mumbai blasts case. The court however did not accept Salem's argument that his detention in Portugal should be considered while calculating 25 years of imprisonment. Salem was extradited in 2005.

356.title: 'House of Cards' actress Kate Mara expecting second child with Jamie Bell
356.article_body: Actress Kate Mara is expecting her second child with actor-husband Jamie Bell. The 'House of Cards' actress made the announcement in an Instagram post on Sunday. "There are three of us in this pic," Mara wrote alongside a photograph of herself and Bell holding hands. Mara and Bell are already parents to a daughter, who was born in 2019.

357.title: Rumours about me joining BJP spreading since 2017: Digambar Kamat
357.article_body: Former Goa CM Digambar Kamat said "rumours" about him joining BJP have been spreading since 2017. "If I wanted to go, I'd have gone. No one can stop me. But still, I led party from the front," he added. "I saw a video of the presser of Dinesh Gundu Rao (Goa AICC in-charge)...It has hurt me beyond words," he stated.

358.title: 23-year-old food delivery man killed in hit-and-run in Mohali
358.article_body: A 23-year-old food delivery man died on the Zirakpur-Panchkula flyover in Mohali’s Dhakoli after a speeding canter hit his motorcycle from behind on Saturday. The incident occurred when he was on his way to deliver food, an official said. The canter driver managed to escape. "We've the canter’s registration number and will be arresting the driver soon," the official added.

359.title: China warns Southeast Asian nations to not be used as 'chess pieces'
359.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi while speaking at Association of Southeast Asian Nations' (ASEAN) Secretariat, said, "We should insulate this region from geopolitical calculations…from being used as chess pieces from major power rivalry and from coercion." This comes after Yi met with US State Secretary Antony Blinken last week. "The future of our region should be in our...hands," he added.

360.title: Was nervous for 'Adipurush', didn't know what I was going to do: Kriti
360.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said that she was nervous about taking up 'Adipurush'. "I didn't know what I was going to do and...how I was going to play part that holds so much importance in our religion and our history...With that weight, you also as an actor feel responsible because you're playing such an iconic character and a part," she added.

361.title: India must be ready to face upheaval due to AI: Rajnath Singh
361.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that India needs to work on artificial intelligence (AI) mechanism "extremely carefully" and it must be ready to face legal, ethical, political and economic upheaval that may follow due to this technology. "It should not be the case that a country or a group of countries establish their dominance on this technology," he added.

362.title: PM Modi unveils 6.5-metre-tall bronze National Emblem on top of new Parliament building
362.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday unveiled the National Emblem cast on the roof of the New Parliament Building, the government said. The bronze cast weighs around 9,500 kg and stands 6.5 metres tall, according to officials. "Historic Moment...Deeply privileged to witness the moment," Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri tweeted.

363.title: Won't take rest till we make Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu: AIADMK leader
363.article_body: Soon after Edappadi Palaniswami was elected as AIADMK’s interim General Secretary, ex-state minister and AIADMK leader Natham R Viswanathan said, "We won't take rest till we make E Palaniswami CM of Tamil Nadu." Furthermore, he said, "O Panneerselvam has a dual face. He doesn't want anyone to have a good life." "I'm happy that he is out now," he stated.

364.title: Indian origin humans to travel to space next year: Union Minister
364.article_body: Union Minister of State for Ministry of Science and Technology, Jitendra Singh has said that the preparations for Gaganyaan, India's maiden human space mission, are complete and humans of Indian origin will go to space next year. The trials of the mission scheduled to take place in 2023 will be conducted by the end of this year, the minister said.

365.title: Everyone knows the bowler will bowl short to Shreyas: Parthiv Patel
365.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said Shreyas Iyer could've taken more responsibility during his 119-run partnership with Suryakumar Yadav in the third T20I against England. He further said that Shreyas needs to work on his shot selection. "Everyone knows that bowler will bowl short to Shreyas...He has to decide whether to attack it or survive by taking singles," explained Parthiv.

366.title: LuLu's biggest mall with 11-storey parking, 15 eateries launched in Lucknow
366.article_body: The biggest mall of LuLu Group International has been inaugurated in Lucknow. The mall has an 11-storey parking facility for over 3,000 vehicles. It also has 15 fine-dine restaurants and cafes and a mega food court with 25 brand outlets. The food court has a seating capacity for 1,600 people. The mall also has a dedicated wedding shopping arena.

367.title: Parts of Hyderabad to face water supply disruption on July 13
367.article_body: Parts of Hyderabad will face water supply disruption for 24 hours from 6 am on July 13 due to construction works for a flyover at Al-Jubail Colony, Falaknuma. The areas that will be hit by water supply disruption include - Kishanbagh, Al-Jubail Colony, Santosh Nagar, Vinaynagar, Saidabad, Chanchalguda, Asmangadh, Yakutpura, Madannapet, Mahbub Mansion, Nallakunta, Aliabad and Balapur.

368.title: India projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country next year: UN report
368.article_body: India is projected to surpass China as the world's most populous country next year, according to a report by the UN which said that the world population is forecast to reach 8 billion by mid-November 2022. The latest projections by the UN suggest that the world's population could grow to around 8.5 billion in 2030 and 9.7 billion in 2050.

369.title: Bharti Airtel shares fall 5% as Adani Group enters 5G spectrum auction
369.article_body: Bharti Airtel shares declined nearly 5% during intraday trade on Monday. On Friday, Adani Group confirmed its participation in India's first 5G spectrum auction that is going to be held on July 26. While Adani Group clarified that its intention is not to be in the consumer mobility space, it'll face Reliance Jio, Airtel and Vodafone India during the auction.

370.title: Can't thank my stars enough for getting Nambi Narayanan's biopic: Mishaa
370.article_body: 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' actress Mishaa Ghoshal took to Instagram to share pictures with Nambi Narayanan and wrote, "Can't thank my stars enough for having this...chance to act in your biopic." Mishaa, who portrayed Nambi's daughter Geetha, added the role will always remain close to her heart. She also thanked Madhavan for "choosing [her] to be...part of this beautiful biopic".

371.title: IndiGo clarifies what is 'Cute charge' after passengers share air tickets
371.article_body: Some passengers took to Twitter and shared pictures of the price breakup of their air tickets, showing that IndiGo had levied a 'Cute charge'. Responding to one of the tweets, IndiGo said, "Please know that the CUTE charges are levied at select airports for the usage of Common User Terminal Equipment (CUTE) services...We'd love to serve you on board!"

372.title: John Abraham starts shooting for next action thriller 'Tehran'
372.article_body: Actor John Abraham has started shooting for 'Tehran', an action thriller film directed by Arun Gopalan. Taking to Instagram, he shared a motion poster, revealing his look from the upcoming project. "Time for some ACTION! #Tehran shoot begins," he wrote. Written by Ritesh Shah and Ashish P Verma, it will be produced by Dinesh Vijan, Shobhna Yadav and Sandeep Leyzell.

373.title: MVA allies should contest 2024 state Assembly polls together: Sharad Pawar
373.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Sunday said it's his personal wish that the three MVA allies, NCP, Shiv Sena and Congress, should fight the 2024 Maharashtra Assembly elections together. "This is my personal opinion. I'll first have to discuss the issue with my party leaders and talks can then be held with the alliance partners," he added.

374.title: Biden says he's considering abortion-related public health emergency
374.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday told reporters that it is "critically important" for people to continue to protest over Supreme Court's ruling on abortion. Moreover, on being questioned about declaring an abortion-related public health emergency, he said that he has asked his administration to consider whether he has the authority to do it and what its impacts would be.

375.title: Defer disqualification pleas against Uddhav, Shinde camps: SC to Maha Speaker
375.article_body: The Supreme Court has asked Maharashtra Speaker Rahul Narwekar to defer disqualification petitions pending against both the Eknath Shinde faction and the Uddhav Thackeray camp. "Please inform the Assembly Speaker not to take up the disqualification petitions until this court hears the matter. Matters won't be listed tomorrow but inform the Speaker," Chief Justice of India, NV Ramana, said.

376.title: Mallya didn't show any remorse, adequate punishment must: SC in contempt case
376.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday while sentencing fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail for a 2017 contempt of court case, said that the latter didn’t show any remorse and didn't appear before it during the sentencing. The court added, "Adequate punishment is a must to uphold the majesty of the law.” The court also fined him ₹2,000.

377.title: O Panneerselvam expelled from all AIADMK posts as Palaniswami takes charge
377.article_body: Former Tamil Nadu Chief Minister O Panneerselvam was on Monday expelled from all posts of the AIADMK after Edappadi K Palaniswami took control of the party as its interim General Secretary. Senior leaders and OPS supporters- JCD Prabhakar, R Vaithilingam and PH Manoj Pandian were also expelled from the AIADMK.

378.title: I'm not vaccinated and I don’t plan to get vaccinated: Djokovic on US Open
378.article_body: Novak Djokovic, who won his seventh Wimbledon title on Sunday, has said he's not sure about his future events due to his unvaccinated status against COVID-19. He stated, "I'm not vaccinated and I'm not planning to get vaccinated." Djokovic is likely to miss the US Open as the country does not allow unvaccinated travellers to enter its borders.

379.title: You look better than you did while working on it: Dalip to Kajol on 'Gupt'
379.article_body: As 'Gupt' clocked 25 years, actor Dalip Tahil told actress Kajol she looks better now than she did while she was working on the movie. Kajol also recalled how she took up the movie. "When Rajiv narrated script to me, I read it and said, 'I'll do it'...He was like, 'You'll really do it? I can't believe it'," she added.

380.title: BJP spokesperson spoke nonsense & our delegates apologised in other countries: KCR
380.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday said that one Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) spokesperson spoke "nonsense" and our delegates and ambassadors apologised in other countries. "Why should the country apologise when BJP has done something wrong?" he asked. Earlier, BJP suspended Nupur Sharma following her remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

381.title: Thappad se dar nahi lagta…Biwi ke surprise se lagta hai: Gaurav Taneja over arrest
381.article_body: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja has tweeted, "Thappad se darr nahi lagta sahab...Biwi ki surprise planning se lagta hai..#birthday". Taneja was arrested on Saturday after thousands of people gathered at a metro station in Noida to celebrate his birthday. His wife Ritu Rathee Taneja wanted to give him a surprise by hosting his birthday in a four-coach Metro, according to the couple.

382.title: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja shares memes over his arrest on birthday
382.article_body: YouTuber Gaurav Taneja (Flying Beast) has shared several memes on his arrest over birthday celebration in Noida metro. He also shared a meme trolling his wife Ritu Rathee for organising a surprise party. He was arrested by the Noida police on Saturday after thousands of people turned up at his 'surprise birthday party' at a Noida metro station.

383.title: Return $40 mn sent to family with 8% interest in 4 weeks: SC to Mallya in 2017 case
383.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday sentenced fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail for a 2017 contempt of court case. Mallya was convicted of contempt in 2017 for transferring $40 million to his children in violation of court orders. The top court has now asked Mallya to return $40 million within four weeks with 8% interest.

384.title: Man cheats Mumbai's customs official of ₹13.50 lakhs by selling fake gold coins
384.article_body: A senior customs official lodged a complaint with police alleging that he was cheated of ₹13.50 lakhs by a man who sold him fake British-era gold coins. As per the victim, he got the coins checked with a jeweller who authenticated them as real. However, during the time of handing over the coins, the seller changed them with fake ones.

385.title: UK Foreign Minister Liz Truss announces bid to run for PM
385.article_body: UK Foreign Minister Liz Truss has announced her bid to succeed Boris Johnson as the next Prime Minister. She wrote in The Telegraph, "Under my leadership, I would start cutting taxes from day one to take immediate action to help people deal with...cost of living." Truss joined 10 other candidates who have declared their bid to run for the post.

386.title: Feels surreal when people call me Avantika: Tamannaah on 7 yrs of Baahubali
386.article_body: Tamannaah Bhatia took to Twitter to share a post marking seven years of her movie 'Baahubali: The Beginning'. The actress, who played Avantika in the film, wrote, "Even after 7 years...when people call me Avantika, it feels surreal." Tamannaah added she feels proud to be a part of a film franchise that has made an impact all over the world.

387.title: Djokovic is a bit of God, I'm not gonna lie: Kyrgios after Wimbledon final
387.article_body: After suffering defeat in the Wimbledon final against Novak Djokovic, Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios said the seven-time Wimbledon champion is a "bit of God". He added, "I played a Slam final against one of the greatest of all time...It was a hell of an occasion." Djokovic won the match 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in three hours.

388.title: Rupee hits new record low of 79.38 against US dollar
388.article_body: The Indian rupee touched an all-time low of 79.38 against the US dollar during Monday's early trade. On Friday, the Indian rupee had closed at a record low of 79.26 against the US dollar. On Monday, domestic markets opened lower with BSE Sensex declining 372.15 points to 54,109.69, and the Nifty was down nearly 0.6% at 16,126.45.

389.title: It was horrifying, river water turned black: Amarnath cloudburst survivor
389.article_body: Nitin Sharma from Rajasthan, who was in Amarnath on the day of the cloudburst, said "it was horrifying". "When we were just one km away from the Baltal base camp, we saw that the water of the river got black and the water level started rising. This seemed...strange," he said, adding he has never seen "such a dark cloud".

390.title: Vijay Mallya sentenced to 4 months in jail, fined ₹2,000 in 2017 contempt case by SC
390.article_body: The Supreme Court has sentenced fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya to four months in jail and imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him after he was found guilty of contempt of court in 2017 for withholding information from the court. The court also reportedly ordered Mallya's family members to return $40 million transferred to them in violation of the court orders.

391.title: Wife, ex-wife, daughter arrested for hiring shooter to kill DTC employee
391.article_body: Days after a Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus driver was shot dead, the Delhi Police arrested his wife, his ex-wife and his 21-year-old daughter for allegedly planning the murder conspiracy. According to the police, they hired a contract killer for ₹15 lakh to execute the murder. Two others, including the contract killer, are absconding, the police said.

392.title: Electricity bills in Delhi for June jumps by 2-6%
392.article_body: The electricity bills received this month by Delhi residents have reflected a hike of 2-6%. The hike, which came into effect on June 10, has happened due to the imposition of an additional power purchase adjustment cost surcharge. Notably, the surcharge will be in effect till August 31, 2022, or till further orders, the Delhi Electricity Regulatory Commission said.

393.title: 3 women destroy US restaurant, attack workers over $1.75 for extra sauce; video surfaces
393.article_body: Three women have been arrested and charged with robbery and criminal mischief after they were filmed destroying a New York City restaurant and attacking workers over $1.75 for extra sauce. One woman was seen hurling a can while other two climbed over the counter and launched bottles of sauce. At one point, one of them even danced on the counter.

394.title: Musk shares laughing meme as Twitter plans legal action against him for ending deal
394.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a meme on Monday after he terminated the $44 billion Twitter deal on Friday. The meme featured Musk laughing at statements such as 'They said I couldn't buy Twitter' and 'They want to force me to buy Twitter in court'. Twitter plans to take legal action against Musk to force him to accept the deal.

395.title: Palaniswami, Panneerselvam supporters clash in TN; some injured
395.article_body:
Some people were injured after supporters of AIADMK leaders Edappadi K Palaniswami and 
O Panneerselvam clashed near the party's headquarters in Tamil Nadu's Chennai amid its General Council meeting. This comes after the Madras High Court allowed AIADMK to hold the meeting today after rejecting Panneerselvam's plea to stall it. A video of the clash shows people throwing chairs.

396.title: India categorically denies reports of sending troops to Sri Lanka
396.article_body: The Indian High Commission in Sri Lanka has categorically denied "speculative" reports of India sending its troops to Sri Lanka. This comes as protesters in Sri Lanka entered the President's official home and set the Prime Minister's private residence on fire amid the economic crisis. "These reports...are also not in keeping with the position of Government of India," it added.

397.title: Some people think they are born to rule: Shinde on Uddhav
397.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said that he was not born with a "golden spoon" and is a common man. Referring to Uddhav Thackeray, he said, "Some people think they are born to rule...They should have felt proud that a common man has assumed the chair." "They are filing petitions...But even the court knows...We haven't done anything illegal," Shinde added.

398.title: Sri Lankan Oppn meets to form new govt as Prez, PM offer to resign
398.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition parties met on Sunday to agree on the formation of a new government as President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and PM Ranil Wickremesinghe offered to resign amid the country's economic crisis. This comes as protesters entered the President's official home and set the PM's private residence on fire. Four Sri Lankan Cabinet ministers have also resigned.

399.title: Video shows stadium developing cracks as football fans jump in Argentina
399.article_body: A video of cracks developing in La Bombonera stadium in Argentina as fans jumped during a Copa Libertadores match between Boca Juniors and Brazilian side Corinthians recently is being widely shared online. The cracks in one of the upper tier stands could be seen moving under the weight of the fans. 'A catastrophe waiting to happen,' a person tweeted.

400.title: Gulzar-Sanjeev Kumar pairing was like Martin Scorsese-Robert De Niro: Anil
400.article_body: Anil Kapoor has said actor Sanjeev Kumar's creative partnership with veteran filmmaker-lyricist Gulzar was equivalent to Martin Scorsese and Robert De Niro's pairing. Sanjeev and Gulzar collaborated on several films including 'Mausam', 'Aandhi', 'Angoor', 'Koshish' and 'Parichay'. Anil was speaking at an event celebrating the 84th birth anniversary of Sanjeev.

401.title: Need to find a way to play players in form in T20Is: Virender Sehwag
401.article_body: Reacting to India's defeat in the third T20I against England, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said India have players who can get going from the start, but unfortunately some of them are sitting out. He added, "Need to find a way to play the best available players in current form in T20 cricket." England won the third T20I by 17 runs.

402.title: Palaniswami elected as AIADMK's interim General Secretary, post elections in 4 months
402.article_body: During a meeting held on Monday, Edappadi Palaniswami was elected as AIADMK's interim General Secretary. AIADMK General Council has adopted resolutions for reviving the general secretary post. It has also adopted resolutions to ensure electing a person for the post by the primary members of the party. The election will be held 4 months from now, news agency ANI reported.

403.title: Lobo, Kamat hatched conspiracy for defection in Cong: Goa AICC in-charge
403.article_body: Goa AICC in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao said Michael Lobo, who was removed as LoP and ex-CM Digambar Kamat were hatching a "conspiracy" by "hobnobbing" with BJP to ensure defection in Congress in Goa. "Kamat did it to safeguard his own skin as so many cases are against him, Lobo did it for the sake of power and position," Rao added.
